org.jpws.pwslib.data

Class PwsRawField

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jpws.pwslib.data.PwsRawField
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Cloneable

    public class PwsRawField
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable
    A RawField contains the value of a single PWS data field (as it typically occurs in a PWS file). By default the value is stored in cleartext (decrypted) but my be caused to be stored encrypted instead.

    Similar to the type String, RawField behaves largely as a constant and after creation of an instance its value cannot be altered, except by destruction. Data getter methods discriminate properly for blocked and unblocked data and length.

    RawField is used primarily in raw-field lists (e.g. the HeaderFieldList) by input and output handling classes, or as a uniform interface to storable PWS fields.

    See Also:
    RawFieldList, HeaderFieldList

    • Constructor Detail

      • PwsRawField

        public PwsRawField(PwsBlockInputStream bs,
                   int format)
            throws java.io.IOException
        Constructs a raw-field by reading its content from a PWS input block stream. The stream is advanced for the number of blocks that define the next field.
        Parameters:
        bs - PwsBlockInputStream
        format - int the file format version (interpretation schema)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • PwsRawField

        public PwsRawField(int type,
                   byte[] data)
        Constructor for a raw-field with a length value and content identical to the parameter byte array. The byte array may be of any size. A copy of the data parameter is used.
        Parameters:
        type - int 0..255; the field's data type (convention of the PWS format definition)
        data - byte array, content of the field (any length); may be null in which case length 0 is assumed

      • PwsRawField

        public PwsRawField(int type,
                   int length,
                   byte[] data)
        Constructor for a raw-field. Parameter length defines the length value of the field independent from the size of the supplied data block. A copy of the data parameter is used.
        Parameters:
        type - 0 .. 255; the field data type (convention of the PWS-File definition)
        length - the length of field data (in bytes)
        data - source of content of this field; any length (missing content will be supplemented by zero bytes); may be null

      • PwsRawField

        public PwsRawField(int type,
                   byte[] data,
                   int start,
                   int length)
        Constructor for a raw-field. Parameter length defines the length value of the field independent from the size of the supplied data block. A copy of the data parameter is used.
        Parameters:
        type - 0 .. 255; the field data type (convention of the PWS-File definition)
        offs - int start offset in data (0 if data is not supplied)
        length - the length of field data (in bytes)
        data - source of content of this field; any length (missing content will be supplemented by zero bytes); may be null

    • Method Detail

      • setEncrypted

        public void setEncrypted(boolean encrypt)
        Tells this raw field whether to store its data block encrypted or in cleartext.

        Note: Method getData() always returns the cleartext.

        Parameters:
        encrypt - boolean true == store ciphertext, false == store cleartext

      • makeTextField

        public static PwsRawField makeTextField(int type,
                                        java.lang.String text)
        Creates a raw-field from a text string. The encoding used is UTF-8; if encoding fails, a runtime exception is thrown.
        Parameters:
        type - int 0..255; the field's data type (convention of the PWS format definition)
        text - String content of the field as a text string (any length); may be null in which case length 0 is assumed
        Throws:
        java.nio.charset.IllegalCharsetNameException - if UTF-8 is not supported by JRE
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if field type is illegal

      • makeTimeField

        public static PwsRawField makeTimeField(int type,
                                        long time,
                                        int length)
        Creates a raw-field for a standard time value. Time is passed in universal epoch milliseconds, but the field value stored is is in seconds (= div 1000). (Time is represented in Little-Endian manner as an integer value ideally of 8 or 4 bytes length.)
        Parameters:
        type - int 0..255; the field's data type (convention of the PWS format definition)
        time - long time value in epoch milliseconds
        length - int length in bytes of binary integer representation (minimum 4)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if length or field type is illegal

        public java.lang.Object clone()
        Returns a deep clone of this raw-field.
        Overrides:

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Two raw fields are equal if and only if their type and data values are equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        true if and only if obj.type == this.type & the data arrays are identical or have equal contents

        public int hashCode()
        Hashcode complying with proprietary equals function.
        Overrides:

      • getType

        public int getType()
        Returns the field's data type as defined in the header block value.

      • getLength

        public int getLength()
        Returns the length of the field value as defined in the header block value.

      • getCrc

        public int getCrc()
        Returns the CRC32 value over the valid data of this raw field. If there is no data defined or the length is zero, zero is returned.
        Returns:
        int CRC32 value

      • getData

        public byte[] getData()
        Returns a data array (a copy) of this field's value of the length as defined in the field's length value. This always returns the cleartext value, even if the field was set to store encrypted.
        Returns:
        array of bytes

      • getPassphrase

        public PwsPassphrase getPassphrase(java.lang.String charset)
        Returns the value of this field as a PwsPassphrase decoded to the parameter character set.
        Returns:
        PwsPassphrase

      • getBlockedSize

        public int getBlockedSize(int format)
        Returns a total size of this field when stored on a PWS persistent state.
        Parameters:
        format - int applicable file format version
        Returns:
        int blocked data length of the field

      • getString

        public java.lang.String getString(java.lang.String charset)
        Returns the data of this field as a String value.
        Parameters:
        charset - String charset name to be applied to the stored byte array; null for system default
        Returns:
        String text string (may be empty but not null)
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalStateException - if charset cannot be applied

      • getBlockCount

        public int getBlockCount(int format)
        The total number of data blocks required to store this field on a persistent state (PWS file).
        Parameters:
        format - applicable file format version
        Returns:
        int number of required data blocks

      • pwsFieldBlockCount

        public static int pwsFieldBlockCount(int datalength,
                                     int format)
        Returns the number of data blocks required to store a PWS data field according to the formatting rules of a persistent state (PWS file).
        Parameters:
        datalength - int length in bytes of usable data of the field
        format - int format version number of the persistent state
        Returns:
        total number of data blocks required to store the field

      • pwsFieldBlockSize

        public static int pwsFieldBlockSize(int datalength,
                                    int format)
        Returns the total data size in bytes required to store a PWS data field according to the formatting rules of a persistent state (PWS file).
        Parameters:
        datalength - int length in bytes of usable data of the field
        format - int format version number of the persistent state
        Returns:
        number of bytes required to store the field

      • writeEncrypted

        public void writeEncrypted(java.io.OutputStream out,
                           PwsCipher cipher,
                           int format)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the contents of this raw-field to an output stream, encrypted by the parameter cipher, blocked and formatted according to the PWS rules for the specified format version.
        Parameters:
        out - OutputStream target data output stream
        cipher - PwsCipher (writing direction)
        format - int the PWS file version format (for values see class Global)
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • writeEncrypted

        public void writeEncrypted(java.io.OutputStream out,
                           PwsCipher cipher,
                           int format,
                           PwsChecksum checksum)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Writes the contents of this raw-field to an output stream, encrypted by the parameter cipher, blocked and formatted according to the PWS rules for the specified format version and optionally updating a checksum object.
        Parameters:
        out - target data output stream
        cipher - PwsCipher (writing direction)
        format - the PWS file version format (for values see class Global)
        checksum - a PwsChecksum which gets updated by the data content of this field; may be null
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • hasData

        public boolean hasData()
        Whether this raw field contains data. A length value of zero is equivalent to void data (returns false).
        Returns:
        boolean true == contains data of length > 0

      • isEncrypted

        public boolean isEncrypted()
        Whether this raw field stores data encrypted internally.
        Returns:
        boolean true == stores encrypted

      • destroy

        public void destroy()
        Erases the contents of the data array and sets all values to zero. After this, the field has no further meaning, sensitive data been effectively cleaned out.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
